push_pull_legs.name: Push/Pull/Legs
push_pull_legs.description: 6-day cycle with 2x frequency per muscle. Balanced volume and recovery.
push_pull_legs.structure: Day 1: Push (Chest, Shoulders, Triceps) • Day 2: Pull (Back, Biceps) • Day 3: Legs • Day 4: Push • Day 5: Pull • Day 6: Legs
push_pull_legs.bestFor: Intermediate to advanced lifters seeking balanced frequency and volume. Ideal for muscle growth and strength gains.

upper_lower.name: Upper/Lower
upper_lower.description: 4-day cycle with 2x frequency. Higher volume per session, time-efficient.
upper_lower.structure: Day 1: Upper Body • Day 2: Lower Body • Day 3: Upper Body • Day 4: Lower Body
upper_lower.bestFor: All experience levels. Perfect for those with limited training days but seeking high frequency.

full_body.name: Full Body
full_body.description: 3-day cycle with 3x frequency. Maximum frequency, excellent for beginners.
full_body.structure: Day 1: Full Body (all major muscles) • Day 2: Full Body • Day 3: Full Body
full_body.bestFor: Beginners or those with limited time. Maximizes training frequency with minimal commitment.
cons: Lower volume per muscle per session

bro_split.name: Bro Split
bro_split.description: 5-day cycle with 1x frequency. Very high volume per session, for advanced lifters.
bro_split.structure: Day 1: Chest • Day 2: Back • Day 3: Shoulders • Day 4: Arms • Day 5: Legs
bro_split.bestFor: Advanced lifters who thrive on high volume and enjoy dedicated muscle days.

weak_point_focus.name: Weak Point Focus
weak_point_focus.description: Custom cycle emphasizing a specific muscle group with 50% more volume.
weak_point_focus.structure: Customized based on selected weak point muscle. Increased frequency and volume for target area.
weak_point_focus.bestFor: Experienced lifters addressing specific muscle imbalances or lagging body parts.

split.title: Choose Your Training Split
split.description: Select how you want to organize your training week. This determines how muscle groups are distributed across workouts.

push_pull_legs.name: Push / Pull / Legs
push_pull_legs.description: Separate pushing, pulling, and leg movements across different days. Ideal for balanced development and high frequency.

upper_lower.name: Upper / Lower
upper_lower.description: Alternate between upper body and lower body workouts. Great for strength and balanced recovery.

full_body.name: Full Body
full_body.description: Train all major muscle groups each session. Perfect for beginners or those with limited training days.

custom.name: Custom Split
custom.description: Let the AI create a customized split based on your preferences and training approach.

bro_split.name: Bro Split
bro_split.description: Classic bodybuilding split with dedicated days for chest, back, shoulders, arms, and legs. Each body part trained with A/B variations for optimal development.

weak_point_focus.name: Weak Point Focus
weak_point_focus.description: Specialized split emphasizing a target muscle group 3-4 times per cycle with increased frequency and volume for rapid improvement.

split.frequencyLabel: How many days per week can you train?
split.frequencyDescription: This helps us optimize your split and volume distribution.

recommendations.label: Recommendation:
recommendations.low: Full Body split is ideal for 2 or fewer training days per week.
recommendations.three: Push/Pull/Legs or Full Body work well with 3 days per week.
recommendations.medium: Upper/Lower or Push/Pull/Legs provide optimal frequency and recovery.
recommendations.high: Push/Pull/Legs allows high frequency training with adequate recovery.

equipment.title: Equipment Preferences
equipment.description: Select all the equipment you have access to. The AI will use this to generate personalized workouts.

weakPoints.title: Identify Your Weak Points
weakPoints.description: Select up to 3 muscle groups that you want to prioritize. The AI will adjust workout volume and exercise selection accordingly.
weakPoints.optionalNote: This is optional - you can skip if you don't have specific weak points.

bodyMap.limitReachedMessage: Perfect! Focusing on fewer muscles gives better results.

point1.title: If everything is a priority, nothing is
point1.description: Trying to improve too many muscle groups at once spreads your recovery capacity thin and slows progress everywhere.

point2.title: Effective prioritization requires specific resources
point2.description: Each weak point needs increased frequency (2x/week vs 1x) and volume (+30-50% sets). You can only sustain this for 1-3 muscle groups.

point3.title: Recovery determines results
point3.description: Your nervous system and recovery capacity are limited. Focusing on 1-3 weak points allows proper progression while maintaining other muscle groups.

point4.title: Rotate priorities across mesocycles
point4.description: Work on 1-3 weak points per mesocycle (6-8 weeks), then rotate. Over time you'll address everything systematically.

strength.title: Strength Baseline
strength.description: Add your current strength levels for exercises you know. This helps the AI set appropriate starting weights.
strength.optional: This is optional - the AI can estimate starting weights if you skip this step.

mentzerHIT.name: Mike Mentzer HIT

principles.sets: <mono>1-2 sets</mono> per exercise to absolute failure

mentzerHIT.philosophyQuote: "More is not better. Better is better. Train with absolute intensity, then allow full recovery for growth."

bottomNote.text: Training approaches are implemented as complete knowledge bases, not hardcoded rules. AI agents query these knowledge engines to make decisions with full methodological fidelity.

fst7.name: FST-7
fst7.creator: Hany Rambod
fst7.description: Fascia Stretch Training for extreme muscle pumps
fst7.configDescription: of fascia stretching protocols and pump techniques

principles.sevenSets: <mono>7 consecutive sets</mono> on final exercise per muscle group
principles.shortRest: Rest: <mono>30-45s</mono> only between sets to maintain pump
principles.hydration: Hydration: <bold>Critical</bold> - sip water between every set

fst7.philosophyQuote: "7 sets with short rest creates an extreme pump that stretches the fascia from within, potentially creating more space for muscle growth. Used by multiple Mr. Olympia champions including Phil Heath and Chris Bumstead."

y3t.name: Y3T (Yoda 3 Training)
y3t.creator: Neil Hill
y3t.configDescription: of weekly variation protocols and intensity techniques
y3t.philosophyQuote: "Systematic weekly variation prevents neural and muscular adaptation. The body never fully adapts because the stimulus constantly changes. After 9 weeks (3 complete cycles), rotate exercises for novelty."
y3t.usedBy: Used by: 4x Mr. Olympia Flex Wheeler

mountainDog.name: Mountain Dog Training
mountainDog.creator: John Meadows
mountainDog.configDescription: of phase protocols and intensity techniques

principles.fourPhases: <mono>4-phase structure:</mono> Pre-activation → Explosive → Supramax Pump → Loaded Stretching
principles.chainsAndBands: Accommodating resistance: <bold>Chains & bands</bold> are fundamental, not optional
principles.noDeload: No programmed deloads for <mono>6-12 weeks</mono> (recovery via exercise rotation)
principles.loadedStretching: Loaded stretching: <mono>30-60s holds</mono> in lengthened positions under load

phases.phase1Detail: Joint prep, blood flow, mind-muscle connection

mountainDog.philosophyQuote: "Combines extreme metabolic stress with mechanical tension. Exercise rotation every 3-4 weeks prevents adaptation plateaus without sacrificing technical mastery. Requires strong work capacity and ability to push beyond typical failure points."

dropSet.name: Drop Set
dropSet.description: Perform reps to near failure, immediately reduce weight by 20-25%, and continue for 2-4 additional drops without rest.
dropSet.whenApplied: Applied to isolation exercises to maximize muscle fatigue at the end of a workout.

restPause.name: Rest-Pause
restPause.description: Complete reps to near failure, rest 10-15 seconds, then continue for 2-4 additional mini-sets.
restPause.whenApplied: Used when seeking extra volume without additional exercises.

superset.name: Superset
superset.description: Perform two exercises consecutively with no rest between them, then rest after both are completed.
superset.whenApplied: Pairs agonist-antagonist muscles (e.g., biceps/triceps) or same muscle group for time efficiency.

topSetBackoff.name: Top Set + Backoff
topSetBackoff.description: Perform one heavy top set at 3-5 reps, then reduce weight by 10-15% for 2-3 higher-rep backoff sets.
topSetBackoff.whenApplied: Applied to main compound lifts for strength and hypertrophy balance.

myoReps.name: Myo-Reps
myoReps.description: Perform an activation set of 12-20 reps, then 3-5 mini-sets of 3-5 reps with only 3-5 seconds rest.
myoReps.whenApplied: Maximizes effective reps on isolation exercises for advanced lifters.

giantSet.name: Giant Set
giantSet.description: Perform 3 or more exercises for the same muscle group back-to-back with no rest between exercises.
giantSet.whenApplied: Used for extreme metabolic stress and time-efficient workouts.

clusterSet.name: Cluster Set
clusterSet.description: Break a set into clusters of 2-3 reps with 15-30 second intra-set rest periods.
clusterSet.whenApplied: Applied to heavy compound lifts for strength focus while managing fatigue.

pyramid.name: Pyramid
pyramid.description: Progressively increase (ascending), decrease (descending), or both (full pyramid) the weight across sets.
pyramid.whenApplied: Used for warm-up progression or exploring different rep ranges in one exercise.

bottomNote.text: Excel gives you full control but zero intelligence. Generic apps track sets but don't understand progression. PTs are great but expensive and unavailable 24/7. Arvo combines AI reasoning with always-on availability at zero cost.

faq.title: Questions?
faq.subtitle: The 6 questions everyone asks before trying a new training app.

offline.question: Does it work offline in the gym?
offline.answer: Yes, completely. All AI decisions run locally with cached models. No internet required during workouts. Data syncs automatically when you're back online. Wake Lock keeps screen on, so you never have to unlock your phone between sets.

customEquipment.question: Can I add my own custom equipment?
customEquipment.answer: Absolutely. Got a specialty machine your gym has? Custom cable attachment? Add it once with a name and example exercises. The AI will suggest exercises for your custom equipment in future workouts. It's in the equipment database permanently.

injury.question: What if I get injured or have pain?
injury.answer: The Insights system automatically detects patterns. Log pain once on French Press? It notes it. Twice? Creates an insight with severity level. Three times? Automatically avoids that exercise and suggests alternatives. Every AI agent reads active insights and adapts decisions accordingly. Zero configuration required.

learning.question: How does the AI learn my preferences?
learning.answer: Three ways: 1) Pattern detection (you substitute Exercise A with B 3+ times → learns preference), 2) Notes extraction (write 'loved this exercise' at end of workout → creates positive memory with NLP), 3) Behavioral signals (consistently high mental readiness on certain movements → confidence boost). All automatic, zero manual tagging. Just write honest feedback and the Pattern Scout agent extracts insights.

vsExcel.question: How is this different from an Excel spreadsheet?
vsExcel.answer: Excel gives you control but zero intelligence. You manually calculate next weight, track volume, decide when to deload. Arvo automates all of it with AI reasoning: set-by-set progression suggestions in <500ms, volume tracking vs MEV/MAV/MRV, automatic deload triggers, biomechanical weight adjustments for exercise swaps, pattern learning from your preferences. Excel is static. Arvo adapts.

dataOwnership.question: Is my training data mine? Can I export it?
dataOwnership.answer: 100% yours. Export anytime to JSON/CSV. Privacy-first design: no data selling, no third-party analytics tracking your workouts. Your training history belongs to you. Supabase backend with row-level security. You own your data completely.

pricing.question: How much does it cost?
pricing.answer: Free to start. Passwordless magic link authentication, no credit card required. Core features (AI workout generation, progression tracking, insights, custom equipment) are available immediately. The goal is to make intelligent training accessible, not to gatekeep behind paywalls.

contestPrep.question: Can I use this for contest prep?
contestPrep.answer: Absolutely. Track volume vs MRV week by week, monitor mental readiness trends across your prep, get automatic deload suggestions when fatigue accumulates. Everything you need for structured contest preparation with intelligent volume management.

periodization.question: Does it understand periodization?
periodization.answer: Yes. Kuba Method has accumulation/intensification/deload phases built in. Mentzer HIT has 4-7 day recovery protocols. The system tracks where you are in your training cycle and adjusts volume, intensity, and frequency accordingly. It's not just logging—it's intelligent periodization.

customPrograms.question: What if I want to run my own program?
customPrograms.answer: You're not locked into Kuba or Mentzer. Track any program you want. The AI still provides set-by-set progression guidance, injury pattern detection, volume tracking, and biomechanical adjustments. Use the intelligence layer with your own programming.

faq.title: FAQ for Coaches
faq.subtitle: Common questions about coaching with Arvo.

invite.question: How do I invite clients?
invite.answer: Share your unique coach link or code. Clients create an account and are automatically linked to you. You can also send direct invitations via email from the dashboard.

clientPay.question: Do clients pay separately?
clientPay.answer: Clients get free access when linked to your coach account. Your subscription covers their app access. You bill clients separately for your coaching services.

customize.question: Can I customize AI-generated workouts?
customize.answer: Absolutely. Every workout goes through you first. Add exercises, adjust volumes, change split - you have full control before the client sees anything.

seeProgress.question: How do I see client progress?
seeProgress.answer: The Coach Dashboard shows all clients at a glance. Click any client to see their Check Room photos, workout history, volume graphs, and all logged data.

clientSwitch.question: Can clients switch to another coach?
clientSwitch.answer: Yes, clients can unlink anytime. Their workout history stays with them. You can also release clients from your dashboard.

maxClients.question: Is there a client limit?
maxClients.answer: The Coach plan supports up to 50 active clients. Need more? Contact us for enterprise solutions.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.metaDescription: Privacy Policy for Arvo - How we collect, use, and protect your data

intro.title: Your Privacy Matters
intro.paragraph1: Arvo is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how we collect, use, store, and protect your personal information, including health data.
intro.paragraph2: We comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and applicable data protection laws.

account.title: 1.1 Account Information
account.intro: When you create an account, we collect:

health.title: 1.2 Health and Fitness Data (Special Category Data)
health.important: IMPORTANT: Under GDPR Article 9, health data is "special category" personal data requiring explicit consent and extra protection.
health.intro: We collect the following health-related data:

fitness.label: Fitness profile:
fitness.value: Training experience level, available equipment, training frequency

performance.label: Workout performance:
performance.value: Exercises performed, sets, reps, weights used, RIR (Reps In Reserve), rest times

pain.label: Pain and injury data:
pain.value: Reported limitations, pain locations, severity, affected exercises

notes.label: Workout notes:
notes.value: Free-text feedback including subjective feelings, fatigue, discomfort

composition.label: Body composition:
composition.value: (if provided) body fat percentage, muscle mass

items.device: Device information (browser, operating system, screen size)
items.ai: AI interaction patterns (e.g., workouts generated, exercises selected)
AI model providers for workout generation (data anonymized)

workout.label: Workout generation:
workout.value: AI uses your profile, history, and limitations to create personalized workouts

exercise.label: Exercise recommendations:
exercise.value: Selecting exercises based on equipment, experience, and preferences

progression.label: Progression tracking:
progression.value: Calculating appropriate weight/rep progressions based on performance

insights.label: Insight extraction:
insights.value: AI analyzes workout notes to detect patterns, preferences, and potential issues

safety.label: Safety features:
safety.value: Avoiding exercises that caused pain or injury

volume.label: Volume management:
volume.value: Tracking weekly volume to prevent overtraining

items.algorithms: Improving AI algorithms and recommendation accuracy
items.behavior: Understanding user behavior to enhance UX
items.features: Developing new features based on usage patterns

items.marketing: Marketing communications (only with your explicit consent)

items.compliance: Complying with legal requirements (e.g., tax, law enforcement)

legalBasis.title: 3. Legal Basis for Processing (GDPR)
legalBasis.intro: We process your data based on:

consent.label: Explicit consent (Article 9):
consent.value: For health data collection and AI processing

contract.label: Contract performance:
contract.value: To provide the Service you signed up for

legalBasis.withdrawal: You can withdraw your consent at any time by contacting us or deleting your account.

database.label: Primary database:
database.value: Supabase (PostgreSQL) hosted in EU data centers

items.rest: Encryption at rest for sensitive data
items.anonymization: Anonymization of data sent to AI providers

active.label: Active accounts:
active.value: As long as your account exists

deleted.label: Deleted accounts:
deleted.value: 30 days (to allow recovery), then permanently deleted

backups.label: Backups:
backups.value: Up to 90 days in encrypted backups

analytics.label: Anonymized analytics:
analytics.value: Indefinitely (cannot be linked back to you)

noSell.title: 5.1 We DO NOT Sell Your Data
noSell.text: We do not sell, rent, or trade your personal data to third parties for marketing purposes.

providers.title: 5.2 Service Providers
providers.intro: We share data with trusted service providers who help us operate:

items.ai: AI models (data anonymized, no PII sent)

providers.compliance: All service providers are bound by data processing agreements (DPAs) and comply with GDPR.

aiProcessing.title: 5.3 AI Model Processing
aiProcessing.intro: When generating workouts, we send anonymized data to AI providers (Anthropic, OpenAI). This data:

items.noPii: Does NOT include your name, email, or other identifying information
items.workoutOnly: Includes only workout-relevant data (exercise history, preferences, limitations)
items.noTraining: Is not used to train AI models (per provider agreements)
items.noStorage: Is not stored by AI providers beyond processing time

legalRequirements.title: 5.4 Legal Requirements
legalRequirements.intro: We may disclose your data if required by:

items.protection: Protection of our rights, safety, or property
items.prevention: Prevention of fraud or illegal activities

rights.title: 6. Your Rights (GDPR)

access.label: Access:
access.value: Request a copy of all personal data we hold about you

portability.label: Data portability:
portability.value: Receive your data in a structured, machine-readable format

restriction.label: Restriction:
restriction.value: Limit how we process your data

objection.label: Objection:
objection.value: Object to processing based on legitimate interests

withdraw.label: Withdraw consent:
withdraw.value: Revoke consent for health data processing at any time

complaint.label: Lodge a complaint:
complaint.value: File a complaint with a data protection authority

rights.contact: To exercise these rights, contact us at privacy@aetha.inc or use the settings page when available.

cookies.title: 7. Cookies and Tracking
cookies.intro: We use minimal cookies and tracking:

items.auth: Authentication tokens (to keep you logged in)

analytics.title: 7.2 Analytics Cookies (Optional)
analytics.disable: You can disable analytics cookies through your browser settings.

children.title: 8. Children's Privacy
children.paragraph1: Arvo is intended for users aged 14 and older. Users under 18 should use the Service under parental supervision.
children.paragraph2: We do not knowingly collect data from children under 14. If you believe we have collected such data, please contact us immediately, and we will delete it.

international.title: 9. International Data Transfers
international.intro: Your data is primarily stored and processed within the European Union. If data is transferred outside the EU (e.g., to AI providers in the US), we ensure adequate safeguards such as:

changes.title: 10. Changes to This Policy
changes.intro: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will:

items.notify: Notify you of material changes via email or in-app notification
items.update: Update the "Last updated" date at the top
items.consent: Obtain your consent if required by law

changes.continued: Continued use of the Service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.euRepInfo: [To be determined if needed based on your business structure]

criticalNotice.title: Critical Notice
criticalNotice.paragraph1: Arvo is NOT a medical device, healthcare provider, or substitute for professional medical advice.
criticalNotice.paragraph2: Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional before starting any exercise program, especially if you have pre-existing health conditions or concerns.

notMedicalAdvice.title: 1. Not Medical Advice
notMedicalAdvice.intro: The information, recommendations, and AI-generated workout programs provided by Arvo are for {strong}informational and educational purposes only{/strong}. They do NOT constitute:
notMedicalAdvice.warning: Arvo cannot and does not replace the expertise of qualified healthcare professionals, physical therapists, or certified personal trainers.

aiLimitations.title: 2. AI Limitations
aiLimitations.intro: Arvo uses artificial intelligence (AI) to generate workout recommendations. You must understand that:

aiCannot.title: AI Cannot:
aiCannot.assessMedical: {strong}Assess your medical condition:{/strong} AI cannot diagnose injuries, illnesses, or health problems
aiCannot.detectContraindications: {strong}Detect contraindications:{/strong} AI may not know about medications, conditions, or risk factors that make exercise dangerous for you
aiCannot.replaceClinical: {strong}Replace clinical judgment:{/strong} AI lacks the nuanced understanding of a medical professional
aiCannot.monitorRealtime: {strong}Monitor you in real-time:{/strong} AI cannot observe your form, fatigue, or distress during exercise
aiCannot.accountUnreported: {strong}Account for unreported conditions:{/strong} AI only knows what you explicitly tell it
aiCannot.guaranteeSafety: {strong}Guarantee safety:{/strong} AI recommendations may be inappropriate or dangerous for your specific situation

aiMistakes.title: AI Can Make Mistakes:
aiMistakes.unsafeExercises: Suggest exercises that are unsafe for you
aiMistakes.misinterpretPain: Misinterpret your feedback or pain reports
aiMistakes.causeInjury: Generate workouts that cause injury or overtraining
aiMistakes.incorrectCues: Provide incorrect technical cues or form instructions

aiLimitations.responsibility: YOU are responsible for critically evaluating all AI recommendations and using your own judgment.

whenConsult.title: 3. When to Consult a Healthcare Professional
whenConsult.intro: You MUST consult a qualified healthcare professional BEFORE using Arvo if you:

conditions.title: Have Any of These Conditions:
conditions.heart: Heart disease, cardiovascular conditions, or high blood pressure
conditions.diabetes: Diabetes or blood sugar regulation issues
conditions.joint: Joint problems, arthritis, or orthopedic conditions
conditions.other: Any other chronic or acute medical condition

medications.title: Are Taking Medications That May Affect Exercise:
medications.performance: Any medication that affects heart rate, blood pressure, or physical performance

over40.title: Are Over 40 and Sedentary:
over40.description: If you are over 40 years old and have been inactive for several months, get medical clearance before starting intense exercise.

familyHistory.title: Have Family History Of:
familyHistory.heartDisease: Heart disease or sudden cardiac death

stopAndSeek.title: 4. Stop Exercise and Seek Medical Help If You Experience:
stopAndSeek.emergencyIntro: STOP IMMEDIATELY and seek emergency medical care if you experience:

emergency.blurredVision: Blurred vision or loss of consciousness

stopAndSeek.consultFor: Also consult a healthcare professional for:

warning.jointPain: Joint pain that persists beyond normal muscle soreness
warning.sharpPain: Sharp or stabbing pain during or after exercise
warning.worseningPain: Pain that worsens over time or doesn't improve with rest

painTracking.title: 5. Pain and Injury Tracking Limitations
painTracking.warning: Arvo's pain and injury tracking features are NOT diagnostic tools.
painTracking.intro: When you report pain or limitations:

items.avoid: AI will attempt to avoid exercises that caused pain
items.cannotDiagnose: AI CANNOT diagnose the cause of your pain
items.cannotDetermine: AI CANNOT determine if exercise is safe for you
items.cannotProvide: AI CANNOT provide medical treatment recommendations

painTracking.conclusion: If you experience pain, consult a qualified healthcare professional (doctor, physical therapist, sports medicine specialist) for proper diagnosis and treatment.

exerciseRisks.acknowledgment: By using Arvo, you acknowledge these risks and voluntarily assume them.

items.progressiveOverload: {strong}Progressive overload:{/strong} Increasing intensity gradually and listening to your body
items.restRecovery: {strong}Rest and recovery:{/strong} Taking adequate rest days and addressing fatigue

scenario.situation: You mention upper chest needs work in your profile.
scenario.response: Every chest session: Incline movements first, when you're fresh. Flat bench comes later. Upper chest gets priority stimulus until it catches up.

result.title: Result:
result.description: Your program adapts to fix imbalances, not just track generic "chest day" volume.

progressiveOverload.title: Progressive Overload, Automated
progressiveOverload.description: Load progression that respects your performance

scenario.situation: Set 1: 100kg × 12 reps @ RIR 1, feeling strong (mental readiness: 4/5)
scenario.response: Set 2: AI suggests 102.5kg × 8-10 reps. You hit top of range with good RIR? Weight goes up. Rep quality is your guide.

alternative.situation: Alternative scenario: Set 1 felt heavy, RIR was 3
alternative.response: Set 2: Weight stays at 100kg, target more reps (10-12). Or AI drops to 97.5kg to keep you in the stimulus zone.

result.title: Result:
result.description: No more guessing "should I add weight?" The system knows, based on your actual performance.

setAdaptation.title: Set-by-Set Adaptation
setAdaptation.description: Your next set changes based on how this one felt

scenario.situation: Planned: 3 sets of 100kg × 8-10. Set 1 is rough—you hit only 8 reps @ RIR 3, mental readiness drops to 2/5.
scenario.response: Set 2 recalculates in real-time: drops to 97.5kg, wider rep range (8-12) for safety. Set 3 might drop further if needed.

result.title: Result:
result.description: The workout adapts to your actual state, not a pre-programmed plan that ignores fatigue.

cycleEvolution.title: Season-to-Season Evolution
cycleEvolution.description: Learns from every mesocycle you complete

scenario.situation: Last mesocycle: Your mental readiness averaged 2.8/5, volume climbed close to MRV by week 4, deload came late.
scenario.response: Next mesocycle: Volume starts lower, frequency drops from 6 to 5 sessions/week, extra focus on recovery. The system learned you were pushing too hard.

result.title: Result:
result.description: Every training block gets smarter based on real data from your previous cycles.

footer.text: not just workout logging. The system understands training principles and applies them to your actual performance.

betaFree.question: Is the beta really free?
betaFree.answer: Yes! During the beta period, you get full access to all features at no cost. This helps us gather feedback and improve the app before the official launch.

afterBeta.question: What happens after beta?
afterBeta.answer: After beta, you can continue with the free tier or upgrade to Pro for €6/month (or €60/year with annual billing). Beta users who upgrade will get early-adopter benefits.

cancel.question: Can I cancel anytime?
cancel.answer: Absolutely. You can cancel your subscription at any time. You'll continue to have access until the end of your billing period, with no hidden fees or penalties.

freeTrial.question: Is there a free trial for Pro?
freeTrial.answer: The beta IS your free trial! You're currently experiencing all Pro features. When we launch, you'll know exactly what you're getting.

payment.question: What payment methods do you accept?
payment.answer: We accept all major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, American Express), PayPal, and Apple Pay. Payments are processed securely through Stripe.

refund.question: What's your refund policy?
refund.answer: We offer a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not satisfied with Pro, contact us within 30 days for a full refund, no questions asked.
